root.title: The Walking Dead Compendium V01, Chapter 1.
Chapter One: Days Gone By

panel-desc.action: Rick and Shane are hiding behind a police car to avoid an active shooter.
Rick and Shane are leaning on a cop car and talking.

balloon.narration: I don't think he is from around here.
I think that's a safe bet. When they opened that prison in grant county I didn't think we'd be getting their run-off!

panel-desc.action: The active shooter is holding a gun.

balloon.narration: I'm ain't goin' back! I'll die first!

panel-desc.action: Rick and Shane are leaning on a cop car and talking.

balloon.narration: DAMMIT! Our back-up is probably more than ten miles away! We're sitting ducks behind this car... Cover me.. I'm going to try and make it to that ditch so we can surround him.

panel-desc.action: Shane is covering Rick but while doing so his gun is shot out of his hand by the shooter.
Shane is holding his hand that was shot and he see's rick being shot in the chest by the shooter.
Rick is laying in a hospital bed and just woke up
Rick is laying in a hospital bed and then removes his oxygen.
Rick sits up and swings his leg to the side of the bed.
Rick hangs onto the IV pole and tries to stand up.
Rick takes a step and falls instantly to the ground.
Rick looks up from the ground and looks for the nurse.
Rick crawls his way back to the bed and finds the emergency button. He pushes the button.
Rick sits with his back against the bed on the floor.
Rick sits with his back against the bed on the floor. He notices the dresser to his right.
Rick opens the dresser and sees his belongings which include his clothes, shoes, keys , and his badge.
Rick is standing the door way of hospital room 251.
Rick starts his way down the hall way. Its empty.
Rick is at the information desk in the hospital.

balloon.narration: What the hell?! Did everyone just decide to take a break at the same time?!

panel-desc.action: Rick continues walking through the empty halls of the hospital
Rick finds an elevator.
Rick eneters the elevator.
The elevator stops and Rick is waiting for the door to open.
The elevator door opens and a zo,bie falls into the elevator.
Rick is standing over the zombie scared.
Rick jumps over the zombie and out of the elevator.
Rick coninues his way down the hospital hall.
Rick continues his way down the hospital halls.
Rick sees a double door and its blocked with a board.
Rick removed the wooden board.
Rick opens the door slowly.
Rick opens the door to a room filled with over 20 zombies.
Rick is scared and moving away from the zombie at the door.
Rick falls to the ground as hes backing away from the zombies. They are startig there way towards them.
Rick is on the floor moving away from the zombie.
The zombie grabs rick by the shirt has he tries to exit the hospital.
The zombie pushes Rick out of the door and they are falling to the ground.
The zombie is ontop of Rick and they are falling down the stairs
The zombies neck snaps on the way down the stairs.
Rick falls onto the zombie at the end of the stairs.
Rick gets up and makes his way down the stairs. Zombies are after him.
Rick pushes a door openand is taking off his belt.
Rick gopes through the door and closes it shut with his belt.

balloon.narration: What the hell was all that?

panel-desc.action: Rick is standing in an almost empty parking structure and there is one car.
Rick tries to open the car door.
Rick walks away from the car.
Rick is outside of the hospital walking down the sidewalk.
Rick contunies to walk down the sidewalk.
Rick comes across a wrecked car and there is a dead body hanging out of it.
Rick sees a bike in the grass up ahead of him.
Rick walks up to the bike.
Rick looks horrified by what he sees.
A deteriated zombie is laying by the bike.
Rick covers his mouth in disbelief.
The zombie sees rick and is looking at him.
A close up to Rick's face.
The zombie lays there on the ground with its mouth open.
A close up to Ricks face and he starts to cry.
The zombie lays on the ground looking at Rick.
Rick is walking down the road with a bike.
Rick falls to his knees dropping the bike.
Rick crys into his hands in the middle of the road.
Rick is still crying into his hands in the middle of the road.
Rick stands up and is looking at the bike.
Rick gets on the bike.
Rick wipes away his tears.
Rick starts riding the bike.
Rick is riding the bike down the empty road.
Rick is riding a bike through a neighborhood.
Rick stops infront of a rundown house.
Rick gets off the bike and makes his way to the front door of the house.
Rick gets closer to the front door.
Rick opens the screen door and grabs the door knob.
Rick walks into the house.
Rick walks pass a family picture showing two parents and a son.
Rick opens a door and peaks into a bedroom.
Rick walks into the kitchen.
Rick steps outside is on the porch.
Rick leans on the railing of the porch.
Rick walks around the outside of the house.
Rick looks around.
A shovel is being swung.
Rick is hit in the back of the head with a shovel.
A young boy is standing above rick holding a shovel.
The father and son are standing above Rick.

balloon.narration: Jesus, Shit! Son.. What did you do?
He was going to try to eat us, Dad.

panel-desc.action: The father and son are standing above rick.

balloon.narration: Grab his feet.. Help me get him inside.

panel-desc.action: Rick wakes up on a couch.
The father and son are in the kitchen. Rick is sitting up looking at them.

balloon.narration: Oh, You're awake. We're just getting ready to have dinner. Would you care to join us?
Wait, what the hell is going on here?!

panel-desc.action: Rick, the father, and the son are sitting at the dining room table.

balloon.narration: Oh, sorry about my boy. He hit you over the head with a shovel.
Huh? What are you talking about?
He thought you were one of those things..

panel-desc.action: Rick is confused.

balloon.narration: "Things?" You mean those monsters that are at the hospital?! Who are you people? What the hell is going on?

panel-desc.action: The father is trying to calm Rick down.

balloon.narration: Whoa, whoa.. calm down there buddy. This was all just a misunderstanding. My boy didn't mean nothing.

panel-desc.action: Rick is wanting answers.

balloon.narration: How did it all happen? What went wrong?

panel-desc.action: The father is confused that Rick doesnt know what has happened.

balloon.narration: What a minute. Hold up. Damn son.. You don't know about any of it?

panel-desc.action: Rick, the father and son are sittign infront of a fireplace. The son is drawing on the floor.

balloon.narration: I was shot... I woke up in the hospital and was atacked. i came home.. My wife and kid were gone.. The whole damn town was deserted. i didn't know what the hell was going on.
All media shut down after a few weeks. I haven't heard much of anything after that. It they found a way to stop it.. they haven't made it here yet. Those things are everywhere.
You say nobody knows what caused it?

A good blow to the head will take 'em out. That's why the boy whacked you with our shovel. Nothing much else seems to faze them. Anytime one wanders into the yard we take care of it. We try to keep quiet.. They'd come after us if they knew we was here.

panel-desc.action: The father looks worried.

balloon.narration: Before they stopped broadcasting they told us to relocate to the bigger cities. They said they could protect us all there. I figured i'd be better off taking my chances here.

panel-desc.action: Rick seems relieved.

balloon.narration: My in-laws line in Atlanta..That's only a five-hour drive from here. That's probably where my wife went. Thank god.. If they're protecting the cities.. Man, I was so worried.

panel-desc.action: The father leans back in his chair. He seems suspicious.

balloon.narration: Oh, yeah.. I'm sure they're fine.

panel-desc.action: Rick stands up holding a key.

balloon.narration: Well.. I need a car if im going to Atlanta.. Want to go shopping?

panel-desc.action: Rick, the father, and the son are standing infront of the police station.

balloon.narration: I figured you for a hunter, after you said you got shot and all. You being a cop.. You don't mind my boy and I taking residence in your neighbor's place do you?

panel-desc.action: Rick looks back at the father while putting the key in the door.

balloon.narration: I'm not going to arrect you if that's what you mean. Most of the houses on my street had been looted. You seemed to be fixing the place up. The Thompson's will probably thank you when they get back. As long as you don't put up a fight over the place.

panel-desc.action: Rick and the father, and his son are standing in the entry of the police station.

balloon.narration: It's not like we're stealing the place.. Your neighborhood just seemed safer. We don't figure that we're hurting anybody by staying there.. and in my book that makes it okay.
You don't have to justify anything to me. You're keeping your son safe. I'm worried sick about mine. I understand.

panel-desc.action: The father seems happy.

balloon.narration: I appreciate that y'know... I don't think I got your name?

panel-desc.action: Rick and the father are shaking hands.

balloon.narration: Rick.. officer Rick Grimes at your service. And you?
Oh, Morgan Jones.. and this here is little Duane.

panel-desc.action: Rick and Morgan are looking around the police station.

balloon.narration: You're a good man, Morgan. I really appreciate you driving me over here. you've helped me out a lot.
It's worth it just to get to talk to someone. If it ain't about cartoons or passing gas..My boy don't want to talk about it.

panel-desc.action: Rick does a half smile and laughs.
Rick looks sad.
Rick looks guilty.

balloon.narration: Damn. After everything I've seen today... I feel guil;ty for laughing.

panel-desc.action: Rick is standing with Morgan and Duane infront of a computer desk. Rick is holding a gun.

balloon.narration: Hey, man... It's okay. you've seen some crazy shit out there... We all have. You can't let it get to you. You just gotta keep going. you can't stop to think about it.. or you'll go crazy.

panel-desc.action: Rick is looks at his gun. Morgan and Duane watch him.

balloon.narration: Oh, this? I figured I might as well bring a few along... just incase. Speaking of which.. Follow me.

panel-desc.action: Rick is opening a locked door. Morgan and Duane are standing behind him.

balloon.narration: I just need to find the right key... here we are.

panel-desc.action: Rick opens and door to a gun vault. Morgan and duane walk in.

balloon.narration: Grab a couple for yourself. if whacking those things over the head with a shovel does them in.. I'm sure those things will work. Should save you some effort.

panel-desc.action: Rick is pointing out where the ammo is located.

balloon.narration: The shells are in the cabinet below the gun rack. Make sure you save some for me. I'll be right back.

panel-desc.action: Duane watches his father Morgan reach for a shot gun.
Morgan is holding two guns while Duane watches.

balloon.narration: Yes, you are.. and I'm gonna teach you how to use one of them tomorrow... but until then they're off limits.

panel-desc.action: Rick walks back into the room and is dressed in his cop uniform.

balloon.narration: Are there enough shells for both of us in there?

panel-desc.action: Rick walks towards Morgan.

balloon.narration: Well.. that getup certainly suits you.

I keep a spare uniform in my locker. I figured if I was going into a big city, and they've got a ton of people holled up there.. I could get around easier being a cop so I might as well look the part.

panel-desc.action: Rick is smiling with a handful of guns and ammo.

balloon.narration: Grab what you're getting and follow me out back. i got another suprise for you.

panel-desc.action: Rick, Morgan and Duane exit the back of the police station into the parking lot. There are patrol cars parked by the door.

balloon.narration: You take that one of the left. It doesn't run as good as the one I'm taking but btter than that hatchback you're driving. If I'm going to make it all the way to Atlanta I'm going to need the newer one.

panel-desc.action: Rick is holding his bag filled with guns and ammo on his back.

balloon.narration: You'll be safer in one of these things if you need to go anywhere.

panel-desc.action: Rick is handing Morgan car keys.

balloon.narration: Don't sweat it, man. I'm just doing my job. I can't think of a better way to "protect and serve" under the circumstances.

panel-desc.action: Rick opens the door to his patrol car. Morgan and Duane watch.

balloon.narration: When things get back to normal... You'll have to give it back.. So try not to bang it up or put too many miles on it.

panel-desc.action: Morgan looks grateful.

balloon.narration: Thank you, Rick. I can't tell you how much this will help us.

panel-desc.action: Rick continues to put his stuff in the patrol car.
Rick looks up from the car.
Rick, Morgan and Duane look to the chainlink fence. Theres a Zombie.
Rick puts his hand on his pistol in the holster of his belt.
The zombie is leaning on the fence. It's face is smooshed against the chain links.
Rick draws his pistol ready to shoot the zombie. Morgan put's his hand ontop of the gun.
Morgan holds his arms out to Rick to stop him from shooting the zombie.

balloon.narration: Leave it be. it can't get to us in here.. you may need that bullet later.

panel-desc.action: Rick puts his gun away.

balloon.narration: Yeah.. you're right. We better get these cars out of here before it makes its way around to the gate.

panel-desc.action: Rick and Morgan are getting into the patrol cars.

balloon.narration: Of course.. we're neighbors. Keep an eye on my house for me.

panel-desc.action: Rick opens the gate for Morgan and Duane to exit. Morgan drives out the gate.
Rick drives the patrol car out of the gate.
Rick gets out of the car and closes the gate behind him.
A zombie watches Rick drive off.
Rick drives through the empty town.
Rick makes it to the highway.
Rick stops the car and gets out.
Rick walks over to the side of the road.
The zombie that Rick ran into by the bicycle is still laying in the same spot.
Rick pulls his pistol out and shoots the zombie.
Rick looks down at the zombie.
The zombie lays dead with a shot to the head.
Rick starts to cry.
Rick wipes away his tears.
Rick walks back to the car.
Rick gets into the car.
Rick drives away.
Rick is driving down the highway at night.
Rick drives past a welcome to Georgia sign.
Rick stops for gas, and its empty.
Rick gets into his patrol car and looks over to see a zombie in a car next to him.
Rick continues driving down the highway.
Rick stops his car and gets out.
Rick grabs his gear out of the patrol car.
Rick starts walking leaving his car behind.
Rick is farther into the ditance leaving his car behind.
Rick sees a farm house in the ditance.
Rick looks at the farm house.
Rick jumps over the fence heading his way towards the farm house.
Rick is standing infront of the house.
Rick knocks on the door.
Rick calls out to see if anyone is home.
Rick turns the door knob to enter the house.
Rick opens the door and steps in.

balloon.narration: I'm not here to hurt or rob you.. I just need some gasoline...

panel-desc.action: Rick walks into the house.
Rick is terrified.
Rick holds is hand to his mouth looking into a living room filled with a dead rotting family.
Rick runs for the door holding his mouth.
Rick makes it to the door and throws up.
Rick wipes his face.
Rick walks towards a locked barn.
Rick unlocked the barn and goes inside.
Rick sees a horse in the barn.
Rick walks up to the horse and pets her.

balloon.narration: Hey, girl. they leave you in here all alone?

panel-desc.action: Rick grabs a saddle to put on the horse.

balloon.narration: I sure could use your help... if you're interested. I'm trying to get to Atlanta. To see my wife and son.

panel-desc.action: Rick puts the saddle on the horse.

balloon.narration: You ever been to Atlanta? It's not really that far away...

panel-desc.action: Rick see's an axe.

balloon.narration: You mind if I take this? I think it might come in handy...

panel-desc.action: Rick gets on the horse.
Rick leaves the barn on the horse.
Rick rides the horse through a field.

balloon.narration: Slow down, girl! I know you've been in that barn for a while, but you're going to wear yourself out.

panel-desc.action: Rick and the horse jump over a fence.
Rick pulls back the reigns.
Rick and the horse find a road.

balloon.narration: That's better... I don't want you passing out before we get there.

panel-desc.action: Rick rides the horse down the road.
Rick is riding the horse and talking to her.

balloon.narration: Y'know... That's a good idea. Talking about the happiest day of my life will surely get my mind off all the messed up shit I've seen recently...

panel-desc.action: Rick is reminiscing.

balloon.narration: i had just gone into work that morning. I was sitting at the station drinking my second cup of coffee for the day. Gilroy was telling me about the drunk they brought in the night before... then the call came.

panel-desc.action: Rick is still talking to the horse.

balloon.narration: It was my wife Lori, her water had broken not ten minutes after I left. I grabbed my coat and ran home to get her. Got Gilory to call Doc Stevens so he could meet us at the hospital.

panel-desc.action: Rick is talking to the horse.

balloon.narration: I got her to the hospital without a hitch. One of the only times I got to use the sirens on my car... It was a small town we lived in. I held her hand the whole time. there were some complications... and she had to get a cesarean. I was really worried... but everything went okay.

panel-desc.action: Rick is talking to the horse.

balloon.narration: The first time I laid eyes on little Carl.

panel-desc.action: Rick looks off into the distance as he rides the horse.
Rick is holding back his tears.
Rick is riding the horse down the road.

balloon.narration: Y'know... on second thought... thinking about the good times makes all this seem so much worse.

panel-desc.action: Rick and the horse arrive in Atlanta.
Rick rides the horse into the city.
Rick passes by an alley.
A zombie laying against a building notices Rick.
Rick continues riding the horse into the city surrounded by zombies.
The zombies on the street are noticing Rick and the horse.
Rick finds himself surrounded by zombies.
Rick and the horse are surrounded by zombies.

balloon.narration: C'mon, girl...let's get the hell out of here!

panel-desc.action: Rick realizes there is no way out.
The zombies close in on Rick and the horse. Making the horse buck Rick off.
Rick falls to the ground with zombies surrounding him.
The zombies attack the horse.
The horse is being eaten by zombies.
Rick watches the horse being eaten and the notices a zombie notice him.
A zombie grabs Rick as he is on the ground with his axe.
Rick swings the axe into the zombies head.
The zombie falls to the side of Rick.
Rick stands up and grabs his axe out of the head of the zombie.
Rick stands up and is surrounded by hundreds of zombies.
The zombies are tearing a person apart.
Rick is outraged.

balloon.narration: Bastards!! What the hell is wrong with you?!

panel-desc.action: Rick starts shooting the zombies.
Rick shots a zombie in the head.
Rick shoots another zombie in the head.
Rick shoots another zombie in the head.
Rick takes an axe and cuts off a zombies head.
Rick finds an alley and makes a run for it.
Someone grabed Ricks shoulder.
A man holds Rick to the side.

balloon.narration: I can get you out of here. Follow me.

panel-desc.action: The man runs ahead of Rick down an alley.

balloon.narration: And stop using that gun! You'll have the whole city on us!

panel-desc.action: Rick and the man look behind them and see zombies are following.

balloon.narration: Don't worry about them. We'll be long gone before they get down here. Stay there.

panel-desc.action: The man pulls down an escape ladder.
The man is pulling the ladder down. Rick is watching the zombies move toward them.

balloon.narration: Got it on the first try...

panel-desc.action: The man starts to climb the ladder while Rick watches.

balloon.narration: C'mon man. I'm trying to save your life here! What're you waiting on?!

panel-desc.action: Rick and the man start climbing up the ladder.

balloon.narration: Sorry... ... It's just ... I've never seen so many of them.

panel-desc.action: The man is climbing on the roof.

balloon.narration: Then you're a lucky man... That's nothing down there... had you gotten fifty more feet into the city before they attacked.. you would not be here right now.

panel-desc.action: The man helps Rick off the ladder and onto the roof.
The man starts to run but Rick just stands there.
Rick holds his hand out.
The man jumps to the next building.
Rick looks over the side of the building scared.
Rick and the man look at each other ontop of the buildings.

balloon.narration: You're going to have to. Listen.. It's easy... I do it all the time. When we climb down this building those things will still be waiting for us at the bottom of that building. And there's no way out of that one. All these buildings are filled with zombies. Trust me.

panel-desc.action: Rick gets ready to jump.
Rick jumps to the other building.
Rick lands short and grabs the side of the building.
The man grabs Rick and helps him onto the building.

balloon.narration: Jesus man! You should have thrown the duffle bag over first!

panel-desc.action: Rick adjusting his hat.
Rick follows the man across the roof top.

balloon.narration: We've got to hurry before they spread out again. When we climb down this building, be ready to run. Don't worry, we don't have far to go.

panel-desc.action: The man starts to climb down the ladder.

balloon.narration: We're not in the clear yet... but this building is close to the woods at the edge of the city. We've got to run about a block before we get to them... and there's liable to be a few of those things on the way. As long as we keep moving, though... they shouldn't be able to surround us.

panel-desc.action: Rick follows the man down the ladder.

balloon.narration: those things are slow as hell, so you should be able to maneuver around them. Don't use your gun.. and don't let them touch you. One bite and it's all over for you.

panel-desc.action: The man and Rick make it to the end of the ladder.
The man and Rick start running down the alley.
Rick and the man slip through a wooden fence.

balloon.narration: From this point on is where we need to be careful.

panel-desc.action: Rick slips through the wooden panels and the man is standing infront of a warehouse.
Rick and the Man run inbetween the warehouses.
While running they go by a zombie that's leaning on the wall.
Rick and the guy continue running.

balloon.narration: You're going to have to keep your eyes open, man. Where've you been for the past month?

panel-desc.action: Rick and the man are running through the woods.
Rick is running.

balloon.narration: Yeah... I woke up in the hospital yesterday.. I...

panel-desc.action: Rick puts his hand on the mans shoulder.

balloon.narration: Can we stop here? Is it safe?

panel-desc.action: Rick looks at the man.

balloon.narration: What you said about the city earlier.. How dangerous it is. Where are all the people that were there?

panel-desc.action: The man looks concerned.

balloon.narration: That... That was them trying to eat us back there. You can't go into the cities anymore.. Everyone that was there is dead. The government tried to herd everyone into the cities so we'd be easier to protect. All that did was put all the food in one place. Every time one of those things kills one of us we become one of them. It took a week for just about everyone in the city to be killed. After that... We don't know. Nobody can get in or out. Did you have family in there?

panel-desc.action: Rick falls to his knees.
The man tries to comfort Rick.

balloon.narration: I'm sorry, man.. I hate for you to have to hear it this way.

panel-desc.action: Rick is crying and wiping away his tears.

balloon.narration: We... we're from Kentucky... but when I was told people were ordered to larger cities I figured my wife would have taken my son to her parents place.. here in Atlanta. They may not have come.. but I don't know where else they'd be.

panel-desc.action: The man offers Rick his hand to help him up.

balloon.narration: Don't give up hope, man... I've seen all kinds of people that have survived some crazy shit. We've got a guy at the camp that actually made it out of Atlanta..

panel-desc.action: Rick wipes his tears away.
Rick and the man start walking.

balloon.narration: Yeah... That's where we're headed. They're more people there.

panel-desc.action: Rick and the man are standing in a big field.
Rick and the man continue walking.

balloon.narration: We're mostly latecomers, people that tried to get into Atlanta too late.. like you. We couldn't get in, so we set up camp here.

panel-desc.action: Rick continues to walk with the man.

balloon.narration: So you're just camping out here? Is that safe?

panel-desc.action: The man responds to Ricks question.

balloon.narration: Yeah... we've got some cars for shelter.. and we all take turns keeping watch at night. We figure if we stick close to the city they'll be able to find us when the government sorts all this mess out.

panel-desc.action: Rick and the man walk up to the camp
Rick looks super suprised.
